summary:
This video summarizes Google's four-hour AI course for beginners in ten minutes.  It clarifies the hierarchical relationship between AI, machine learning, deep learning, and large language models (LLMs).  AI is the overarching field, with machine learning as a subfield. Deep learning, a subset of machine learning using artificial neural networks, further branches into discriminative and generative models.  LLMs fall under deep learning and are closely related to generative models, powering tools like ChatGPT and Bard.

The video explains key concepts: machine learning uses input data to train models for predictions (supervised learning uses labeled data, unsupervised uses unlabeled data); deep learning leverages artificial neural networks for more complex tasks, including semi-supervised learning (combining labeled and unlabeled data); discriminative models classify data, while generative models create new data based on learned patterns.  Generative AI (GenAI) outputs include text, images, audio, and video, unlike discriminative models which produce classifications or probabilities.  Different GenAI model types exist, including text-to-text, text-to-image, text-to-video, text-to-3D, and text-to-task models.

Finally, the video distinguishes LLMs from GenAI, explaining that while overlapping, LLMs are pre-trained on vast datasets and then fine-tuned for specific applications, analogous to training a dog for a specific role after basic obedience training.
